metadata.title: CVE-2023-1170 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based Buffer Overflow in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 9.0.1376.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1170` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm7').
